enum NONE

Attention:
PHP is not compiled, otherwise would use bindec()

Do not use bitwise shift operator either, would mean 100+ shifts for constant values! Shell command argument types

ComputeArgCounts ( $  commands,
$  argv,
$  cmd,
&$  actual,
&$  expected,
&$  acceptable,
&$  check 
)

Compute and fill arg count variables.

Parameters:
[in] $commands Available commands for the current model
[in] $argv Argument vector
[in] $cmd Method name, key to $commands
[out] $actual Given arg count
[out] $expected Expected arg count
[out] $acceptable Acceptable arg count
[out] $check Arg count used while validating

Attention:
There may be extra or missing args, hence min() here

Definition at line 462 of file lib.php.

00463 {
00464     $actual= count($argv);
00465     $expected= count($commands[$cmd]['argv']);
00466 
00467     $acceptable= $expected;
00468     for ($argpos= 0; $argpos < $expected; $argpos++) {
00469         $argtype= $commands[$cmd]['argv'][$argpos];
00470         if ($argtype & NONE) {
00471             $acceptable--;
00472         }
00473     }
00474     
00476     $check= min($actual, $expected);
00477 }

cwc_syslog ( $  prio,
$  file,
$  func,
$  line,
$  msg 
)

Wrapper for controller error logging via syslog.

A global $LOG_LEVEL is set in setup.php.

Parameters:
[in] $prio Log priority checked against $LOG_LEVEL
[in] $file Source file the function is in
[in] $func Function where the log is taken
[in] $line Line number within the function
[in] $msg Log message

IsDateTime ( $  datetime  ) 

Checks type of datetime string as supplied to date command.

Parameters:
[in] $datetime Arg
Returns:
boolean Type check result

There should be 10 digits.

Year can be 00-99, so no need to check.

Definition at line 429 of file lib.php.

00437         //$Year= $datetime[0] + 0;

ValidateArgs ( $  commands,
$  command,
$  argv,
$  check 
)

Checks types of the arguments passed.

The arguments are checked against the types listed in $commands.

Parameters:
[in] $commands Available commands for the current model
[in] $command Method name, key to $commands
[in] $argv Argument vector
[out] $check Arg count used while validating
Returns:
boolean Validation result
Todo:
There are 2 types of argument checks in this project, which one to choose?

Definition at line 491 of file lib.php.

References $ArgTypes, $retval, cwc_syslog(), and ViewError().

00492 {
00493     global $ArgTypes;
00494 
00495     $helpmsg= $commands[$command]['desc'];
00496     $logmsg= $commands[$command]['desc'];
00497     
00498     $valid= FALSE;
00499     // Check each argument in order
00500     for ($argpos= 0; $argpos < $check; $argpos++) {
00501         $arg= $argv[$argpos];
00502         $argtype= $commands[$command]['argv'][$argpos];
00503 
00504         // Multiple types may match for an arg, hence the foreach loop
00505         foreach ($ArgTypes as $type => $conf) {
00506             // Acceptable types are bitwise ORed, hence the AND here
00507             if ($argtype & $type) {
00508                 $validatefunc= $conf['func'];
00509                 if ($validatefunc($arg)) {
00510                     $valid= TRUE;
00511 
00512                     if ($type & FILEPATH) {
00513                         // Further check if file really exists
00514                         exec("[ -e $arg ]", $output, $retval);
00515                         if ($retval !== 0) {
00516                             $valid= FALSE;
00517 
00518                             $errormsg= "$command: $arg";
00519                             ViewError(_('No such file').": $errormsg");
00520                             cwc_syslog(LOG_NOTICE, __FILE__, __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, "No such file: $errormsg");
00521                         }
00522                     }
00523 
00524                     if ($valid) {
00525                         // One type succeded, hence do not check for other possible types for this arg
00526                         break;
00527                     }
00528                 }
00529                 else {
00530                     $valid= FALSE;
00531                     
00532                     $helpmsg.= "\n"._($conf['desc']).': '.$arg;
00533                     $logmsg.= "\n".$conf['desc'].': '.$arg;
00534                     // Will keep checking if further types are possible for this arg
00535                 }
00536             }
00537         }
00538 
00539         if (!$valid) {
00540             // One arg failed to check, do not run the func
00541             break;
00542         }
00543     }
00544     
00545     if (!$valid) {
00546         ViewError(_('Arg type check failed').": $helpmsg");
00547         cwc_syslog(LOG_NOTICE, __FILE__, __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, "Arg type check failed: $logmsg");
00548     }
00549     return $valid;
00550 }
